Simulation Module

API Reference

The base components define foundational functionality of the Simulation class that performs week-to-week simulations across all specified realizations.

Base Components

Simulation.h

class Simulation
#include <Simulation.h>

The Simulation class represents the main simulation object that implements the simulation process.

Public Functions

Simulation(vector<WaterSource*> &water_sources, Graph &water_sources_graph, const vector<vector<int>> &water_sources_to_utilities, vector<Utility*> &utilities, const vector<DroughtMitigationPolicy*> &drought_mitigation_policies, vector<MinEnvFlowControl*> &min_env_flow_controls, vector<vector<double>> &utilities_rdm, vector<vector<double>> &water_sources_rdm, vector<vector<double>> &policies_rdm, const unsigned long total_simulation_time, vector<unsigned long> &realizations_to_run)

Constructor for the Simulation class.

This constructor initializes a simulation with the provided parameters, setting up water sources, utilities, drought mitigation policies, environmental flow controls, and various randomization matrices for the simulation. It also sets up the realization processes to be run during the simulation.

Parameters

  • water_sources – A vector of water source pointers that are part of the simulation.

  • water_sources_graph – A graph representing the relationships between water sources.

  • water_sources_to_utilities – A matrix that maps water sources to utilities.

  • utilities – A vector of utility pointers involved in the simulation.

  • drought_mitigation_policies – A vector of drought mitigation policies.

  • min_env_flow_controls – A vector of minimum environmental flow controls.

  • utilities_rdm – A matrix of utilities randomization data.

  • water_sources_rdm – A matrix of water sources randomization data.

  • policies_rdm – A matrix of policies randomization data.

  • total_simulation_time – The total duration of the simulation.

  • realizations_to_run – A vector of realization IDs to be run during the simulation.

Returns

None

Simulation(vector<WaterSource*> &water_sources, Graph &water_sources_graph, const vector<vector<int>> &water_sources_to_utilities, vector<Utility*> &utilities, const vector<DroughtMitigationPolicy*> &drought_mitigation_policies, vector<MinEnvFlowControl*> &min_env_flow_controls, vector<vector<double>> &utilities_rdm, vector<vector<double>> &water_sources_rdm, vector<vector<double>> &policies_rdm, const unsigned long total_simulation_time, vector<unsigned long> &realizations_to_run, vector<vector<Matrix2D<double>>> &precomputed_rof_tables, vector<vector<double>> &table_storage_shift, vector<vector<double>> &table_base_storage_shift, vector<vector<double>> &treatment_demand_buffer_shift, string &rof_tables_folder)

Constructor for the Simulation class with precomputed ROF tables and shifts for storage and treatment ROFs.

This constructor initializes a simulation with the provided parameters, setting up water sources, utilities, drought mitigation policies, environmental flow controls, various randomization matrices, and precomputed ROF tables for the simulation. It also imports pre-computed ROF tables and sets up the realization processes to be run during the simulation.

See also

setupSimulation

Parameters

  • water_sources – A vector of water source pointers that are part of the simulation.

  • water_sources_graph – A graph representing the relationships between water sources.

  • water_sources_to_utilities – A matrix that maps water sources to utilities.

  • utilities – A vector of utility pointers involved in the simulation.

  • drought_mitigation_policies – A vector of drought mitigation policies.

  • min_env_flow_controls – A vector of minimum environmental flow controls.

  • utilities_rdm – A matrix of utilities randomization data.

  • water_sources_rdm – A matrix of water sources randomization data.

  • policies_rdm – A matrix of policies randomization data.

  • total_simulation_time – The total duration of the simulation.

  • realizations_to_run – A vector of realization IDs to be run during the simulation.

  • precomputed_rof_tables – A vector of precomputed ROF tables used for simulation.

  • table_storage_shift – A matrix of storage shifts for the ROF tables.

  • table_base_storage_shift – A matrix of base storage shifts for the ROF tables.

  • treatment_demand_buffer_shift – A matrix of treatment demand buffer shifts for the ROF tables.

  • rof_tables_folder – A string representing the folder containing the ROF tables.

Returns

None

Simulation(vector<WaterSource*> &water_sources, Graph &water_sources_graph, const vector<vector<int>> &water_sources_to_utilities, vector<Utility*> &utilities, const vector<DroughtMitigationPolicy*> &drought_mitigation_policies, vector<MinEnvFlowControl*> &min_env_flow_controls, vector<vector<double>> &utilities_rdm, vector<vector<double>> &water_sources_rdm, vector<vector<double>> &policies_rdm, const unsigned long total_simulation_time, vector<unsigned long> &realizations_to_run, string &rof_tables_folder)

Constructor for the Simulation class with the option to export ROF tables.

This constructor initializes a simulation with the provided parameters, setting up water sources, utilities, drought mitigation policies, environmental flow controls, various randomization matrices, and enables the export of ROF tables for the simulation. It also allows ROF tables to be exported and sets up the realization processes to be run during the simulation.

Parameters

  • water_sources – A vector of water source pointers that are part of the simulation.

  • water_sources_graph – A graph representing the relationships between water sources.

  • water_sources_to_utilities – A matrix that maps water sources to utilities.

  • utilities – A vector of utility pointers involved in the simulation.

  • drought_mitigation_policies – A vector of drought mitigation policies.

  • min_env_flow_controls – A vector of minimum environmental flow controls.

  • utilities_rdm – A matrix of utilities randomization data.

  • water_sources_rdm – A matrix of water sources randomization data.

  • policies_rdm – A matrix of policies randomization data.

  • total_simulation_time – The total duration of the simulation.

  • realizations_to_run – A vector of realization IDs to be run during the simulation.

  • rof_tables_folder – A string representing the folder containing the ROF tables.

Returns

None

Simulation &operator=(const Simulation &simulation)

Assignment operator for the Simulation class.

This operator allows for the assignment of one Simulation object to another. It copies the number of realizations from the source Simulation object to the current one. The other member variables are not copied, as this operator is minimal and only handles the number of realizations.

Parameters

simulation – The Simulation object to assign to the current object.

Returns

A reference to the current Simulation object after assignment.

virtual ~Simulation()

Destructor for the Simulation class.

This destructor handles the cleanup of any resources allocated during the simulation’s execution. It is defined as default, relying on the compiler-generated destructor for cleaning up member variables.

Returns

None

MasterDataCollector *runFullSimulation(unsigned long n_threads, double *vars)

Runs the full simulation across multiple realizations.

This function executes a full simulation over a specified number of realizations, with each realization being processed in parallel using OpenMP. The function checks the validity of the imported ROF tables and then initializes the necessary models and data collectors. The simulation calculates risk-of-failure, applies drought mitigation policies, and performs continuity calculations for each week of the simulation. The data is collected and exported if required.

Parameters

  • n_threads – The number of threads to be used for parallel execution.

  • vars – A pointer to an array containing decision variables used for error reporting in case of a failure.

Throws

Throws – an exception if there is a mismatch in the number of utilities or imported ROF tables, or if an error occurs during the simulation of any realization.

Returns

A pointer to the MasterDataCollector that contains the collected data from all realizations.

void setupSimulation(vector<WaterSource*> &water_sources, Graph &water_sources_graph, const vector<vector<int>> &water_sources_to_utilities, vector<Utility*> &utilities, const vector<DroughtMitigationPolicy*> &drought_mitigation_policies, vector<MinEnvFlowControl*> &min_env_flow_controls, vector<vector<double>> &utilities_rdm, vector<vector<double>> &water_sources_rdm, vector<vector<double>> &policies_rdm, vector<unsigned long> &realizations_to_run)

Set up the simulation by initializing water sources, utilities, and various components.

This function performs initial setup for the simulation, including sorting water sources and utilities by ID, validating the consistency of IDs, and ensuring that the correct water sources are linked to the respective utilities. It also creates the data collector for the simulation.

Parameters

  • water_sources – A vector of water source pointers that are part of the simulation.

  • water_sources_graph – A graph representing the relationships between water sources.

  • water_sources_to_utilities – A matrix that maps water sources to utilities.

  • utilities – A vector of utility pointers involved in the simulation.

  • drought_mitigation_policies – A vector of drought mitigation policies.

  • min_env_flow_controls – A vector of minimum environmental flow controls.

  • utilities_rdm – A matrix of utilities randomization data.

  • water_sources_rdm – A matrix of water sources randomization data.

  • policies_rdm – A matrix of policies randomization data.

  • realizations_to_run – A vector of realization IDs to be run during the simulation.

Throws

invalid_argument – if any of the following conditions are met:

  • Water sources or utilities IDs are not sequential.

  • A water source is listed in the construction order of a utility but not in its source list.

  • A water source declared for a utility is not present in the list of all water sources.

Returns

None

void createContinuityModels(unsigned long realization, ContinuityModelRealization *&realization_model, ContinuityModelROF *&rof_model)

Creates and initializes realization and ROF models for the simulation.

This function creates two types of models for the specified realization: a ContinuityModelRealization and a ContinuityModelROF. The function copies the necessary data (e.g., water sources, utilities, drought mitigation policies) and initializes these models. The ROF model is also connected to the relevant realization water sources and utilities, and the appropriate ROF tables are set if needed.

Parameters

  • realization – The index of the realization to create models for.

  • realization_model – A reference to the ContinuityModelRealization object to be created.

  • rof_model – A reference to the ContinuityModelROF object to be created.

Returns

None

void printProgress(double percentage)

Prints the progress of a task in percentage and visual bar format.

This function prints a progress bar on the same line in the console, displaying the percentage of completion along with a visual representation using a progress bar.

Parameters

percentage – The percentage of completion (a value between 0 and 1).

Returns

void

Private Functions

void setRof_tables_folder(const string &rof_tables_folder)

Sets the folder path for the ROF tables.

This function sets the folder path where the ROF tables will be stored or imported from.

Parameters

rof_tables_folder – The path to the folder where ROF tables are located or should be stored.

Returns

void

Private Members

const unsigned long total_simulation_time

The total time required to run the simulation.

vector<unsigned long> realizations_to_run

The vector containing the IDs of the realizations to run.

const int import_export_rof_tables

Flag indicating if the simulation should import, export, or generate ROF tables.

unsigned long n_realizations

The number of realizations to run.

vector<WaterSource*> &water_sources

The reference to a vector containing the water sources in the model.

Graph &water_sources_graph

The reference to the graph containing the water sources in the model.

const vector<vector<int>> &water_sources_to_utilities

The reference to the 2D vector containing the IDs of the water sources to utilities.

vector<Utility*> &utilities

The reference to a vector containing the utilities in the model.

const vector<DroughtMitigationPolicy*> &drought_mitigation_policies

The reference to a vector containing the drought mitigation policies in the model.

vector<MinEnvFlowControl*> &min_env_flow_controls

The reference to a vector containing the minimum environmental flow controls in the model.

vector<vector<double>> &utilities_rdm

The reference to a 2D vector containing the DU factor demand multipliers for the utilities.

vector<vector<double>> &water_sources_rdm

The reference to a 2D vector containing the random DU permitting, construction, and financing multipliers for the water sources.

vector<vector<double>> &policies_rdm

The reference to a 2D vector containing the random DU drought mitigation policies.

vector<vector<Matrix2D<double>>> *precomputed_rof_tables

The pointer to a 2D vector containing matrices that store the precomputed ROF tables.

vector<vector<double>> *table_storage_shift

The pointer to a 2D vector containing the shifts in storage for the ROF tables.

vector<vector<double>> *table_base_storage_shift

The pointer to a 2D vector containing the shifts in base storage for the ROF tables.

vector<vector<double>> *treatment_demand_buffer_shift

The pointer to a 2D vector containing the shifts in treatment demand for the ROF tables.

MasterDataCollector *master_data_collector = nullptr

The pointer to the master data collector.

string rof_tables_folder

The folder where the ROF tables are stored.
